item.title: Senate Panel To Probe How To Bring Stability To Health Insurance Market
item.description: August 3, 2017 - GOP Sen. Lamar Alexander has organized bipartisan hearings aimed at preventing a "death spiral" on the health insurance market. David Greene talks to Democratic Sen. Maggie Hassan of New Hampshire.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 3, 2017 - GOP Sen. Lamar Alexander has organized bipartisan hearings aimed at preventing a "death spiral" on the health insurance market. David Greene talks to Democratic Sen. Maggie Hassan of New Hampshire. http://www.npr.org/2017/08/03/541318222/senate-panel-to-probe-how-to-bring-stability-to-health-insurance-market

item.title: 'If You Hemorrhage, Don't Clean Up': Advice From Mothers Who Almost Died
item.description: August 3, 2017 - We've heard from 3,100 women who survived life-threatening complications of pregnancy or childbirth. They told us what they wished they had known and what they would say to new and expectant mothers.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 3, 2017 - We've heard from 3,100 women who survived life-threatening complications of pregnancy or childbirth. They told us what they wished they had known and what they would say to new and expectant mothers. http://www.npr.org/2017/08/03/541191480/if-you-hemorrhage-dont-clean-up-advice-from-mothers-who-almost-died

item.title: To Grow Market Share, A Drugmaker Pitches Its Product To Judges
item.description: August 3, 2017 - The pharmaceutical company Alkermes is trying to increase the number of people taking Vivitrol for their opioid addiction by marketing the drug to judges, who have the power to influence treatment.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 3, 2017 - The pharmaceutical company Alkermes is trying to increase the number of people taking Vivitrol for their opioid addiction by marketing the drug to judges, who have the power to influence treatment. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/08/03/540029500/to-grow-market-share-a-drugmaker-pitches-its-product-to-judges

item.title: 1 Million Malnourished Children At Risk Of Cholera In Yemen
item.description: August 2, 2017 - That's according to a new analysis from Save the Children. Yemen's outbreak is the world's worst in a single year since records have been kept, according to Oxfam.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 2, 2017 - That's according to a new analysis from Save the Children. Yemen's outbreak is the world's worst in a single year since records have been kept, according to Oxfam. http://www.npr.org/2017/08/02/541181026/one-million-malnourished-children-at-risk-of-cholera-in-yemen

item.title: Scientists Precisely Edit DNA In Human Embryos To Fix A Disease Gene
item.description: August 2, 2017 - In experimental embryos, scientists were able to repair the gene that causes a serious heart disorder. More research is needed to confirm the method would produce healthy babies, they say.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 2, 2017 - In experimental embryos, scientists were able to repair the gene that causes a serious heart disorder. More research is needed to confirm the method would produce healthy babies, they say. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/08/02/540975224/scientists-precisely-edit-dna-in-human-embryos-to-fix-a-disease-gene

item.title: Many Avoid End-Of-Life Care Planning, Study Finds
item.description: August 2, 2017 - Only about a third of U.S. adults have advance directives in place to guide the care they receive if they become too ill to make their own medical decisions.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 2, 2017 - Only about a third of U.S. adults have advance directives in place to guide the care they receive if they become too ill to make their own medical decisions. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/08/02/540669492/many-avoid-end-of-life-care-planning-study-finds

item.title: VIDEO: Little-Known Middlemen Save Money On Medicines — But Maybe Not For You
item.description: August 2, 2017 - Many people have never heard of pharmacy benefit managers. They're the companies that help insurers decide what drugs to cover and how much you pay for them.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 2, 2017 - Many people have never heard of pharmacy benefit managers. They're the companies that help insurers decide what drugs to cover and how much you pay for them. http://www.npr.org/2017/08/02/540918790/video-little-known-middlemen-save-money-on-medicines-but-maybe-not-for-you

item.title: Should The Opioid Crisis Be Declared A National Emergency?
item.description: August 2, 2017 - Addiction treatment professionals are praising many of the recommendations of a White House commission on the opioid crisis. But some question the recommendation to declare it a national emergency.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 2, 2017 - Addiction treatment professionals are praising many of the recommendations of a White House commission on the opioid crisis. But some question the recommendation to declare it a national emergency. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/08/02/541071209/should-the-opioid-crisis-be-declared-a-national-emergency

item.title: Trump Threatens Congress' Health Care; Senate Republicans Don't Seem Too Worried
item.description: August 2, 2017 - President Trump tweeted that he would undo federal subsidies for congressional health care if the Senate didn't keep its focus on repealing Obamacare. GOP leaders are still moving on to other issues.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 2, 2017 - President Trump tweeted that he would undo federal subsidies for congressional health care if the Senate didn't keep its focus on repealing Obamacare. GOP leaders are still moving on to other issues. http://www.npr.org/2017/08/02/540975904/senate-republicans-dont-seem-too-worried-about-trumps-subsidy-threat

item.title: Federal Judge Strikes Down Portions Of An Alabama Abortion Law
item.description: August 1, 2017 - Under the law, a minor who didn't have parental consent for an abortion could have faced a legal proceeding involving her parents, the district attorney and a person representing the fetus.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 1, 2017 - Under the law, a minor who didn't have parental consent for an abortion could have faced a legal proceeding involving her parents, the district attorney and a person representing the fetus. http://www.npr.org/2017/08/01/540932724/federal-judge-strikes-down-portions-of-an-alabama-abortion-law

item.title: A Big Win For Afghan Women's Wheelchair Hoopsters
item.description: August 1, 2017 - The players used to be shy about playing sports as women using wheelchairs. Today, they're international champions and role models in their country.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 1, 2017 - The players used to be shy about playing sports as women using wheelchairs. Today, they're international champions and role models in their country. http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/08/01/540910077/afghanistan-s-female-wheelchair-basketball-wins

item.title: 'I Was Somebody's Mother': Reflections On The Guilt And Grief Of Miscarriage
item.description: August 1, 2017 - Ariel Levy was five months pregnant and alone in a hotel room in Mongolia when she gave birth. Her son lived only 10 minutes. Afterward, Levy was haunted by the notion that she had caused his death.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 1, 2017 - Ariel Levy was five months pregnant and alone in a hotel room in Mongolia when she gave birth. Her son lived only 10 minutes. Afterward, Levy was haunted by the notion that she had caused his death. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/08/01/540822381/i-was-somebodys-mother-reflections-on-the-guilt-and-grief-of-miscarriage

item.title: Drug Puts A $750,000 'Price Tag On Life'
item.description: August 1, 2017 - The high cost of Spinraza, a new and promising treatment for spinal muscular atrophy, highlights how the cost-benefit analysis insurers use to make drug coverage decisions plays out in human terms.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 1, 2017 - The high cost of Spinraza, a new and promising treatment for spinal muscular atrophy, highlights how the cost-benefit analysis insurers use to make drug coverage decisions plays out in human terms. http://www.npr.org/2017/08/01/540100976/drug-puts-a-750-000-price-tag-on-life

item.title: Planning To Watch The Eclipse? Here's What You Need To Protect Your Eyes
item.description: August 1, 2017 - A total solar eclipse is one of the most magnificent sights you can ever see. But you need the right kind of eye protection, and some of what's being sold out there isn't safe.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 1, 2017 - A total solar eclipse is one of the most magnificent sights you can ever see. But you need the right kind of eye protection, and some of what's being sold out there isn't safe. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/08/01/540661570/planning-to-watch-the-eclipse-heres-what-you-need-to-protect-your-eyes

item.title: This Doctor Was Ready To Have Her Baby When She Delivered Another
item.description: August 1, 2017 - Dr. Amanda Hess was about to give birth when she heard a woman wailing in pain. The on-call doctor was on break, so Hess delivered the woman's baby. Her own contractions started a few moments later.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 1, 2017 - Dr. Amanda Hess was about to give birth when she heard a woman wailing in pain. The on-call doctor was on break, so Hess delivered the woman's baby. Her own contractions started a few moments later. http://www.npr.org/2017/08/01/540755123/this-doctor-was-ready-to-have-her-baby-when-she-delivered-another
